parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
